title: Rihanna turned down Super Bowl because she 'couldn’t be a sellout'
text:
Rihanna knows what she wants (Picture: Rex Features)

Rihanna won’t be playing ball with the Super Bowl after admitting she turned down the NFL’s prestigious half-time show amid solidarity with player Colin Kaepernick.

Finally lifting the lid on her new music, RiRi was all of a flutter in floaty frocks as she posed for American Vogue.

And, spilling on her NFL showdown for the first time, she revealed she had declined $100million to stage the most-watched gig on the planet in support of player Colin Kaepernick, who famously knelt on the pitch in protest at police brutality and racism in the US.

Slamming the door on the gig of a lifetime, the Diamonds singer said: ‘I couldn’t dare do that. For what? Who gains from that?

Rihanna graces us with her presence on the November cover of Vogue America

‘Not my people. I just couldn’t be a sell-out. I couldn’t be an enabler. There’s things within that organisation that I do not agree with at all, and I was not about to go and be of service to them in any way.’

As the agonising wait for her follow-up to 2016’s Anti continues, the 31-year-old Barbadian did share that she is going back to her roots when her album does finally drop.

‘I like to look at it as a reggae-inspired or reggae-infused album,’ she said. ‘It’s not gonna be typical of what you know as reggae. But you’re going to feel the elements in all of the tracks.

‘Reggae always feels right to me. It’s in my blood. It doesn’t matter how far or long removed I am from that culture, or my environment that I grew up in; it never leaves. It’s always the same high.’

Once she has finished the entrepreneur — who also juggles music with her lingerie and make-up businesses — says she ‘without a doubt’ wants to have kids with 31-year-old Saudi billionaire Hassan Jameel.

The Umbrella hitmaker has been dating the businessman, for two years and they’re still going strong with RiRi pretty much confirming that they’re in it for the long haul and sees marriage in their future.

She even revealed which designer would have the absolute pleasure of creating the gown for her future wedding: ‘It would probably be a collaboration between myself and [John] Galliano, of course.’
